# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(s)
    result = String[]
    current_line = String[]
    current_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if current_length + length(word) + length(current_line) > text_width
            push!(result, join(current_line, ' '))
            current_line = [word]
            current_length = length(word)
        else
            push!(current_line, word)
            current_length += length(word)
        end
    end
    
    push!(result, join(current_line, ' '))
    return join(result, '\n')
end

# Example usage
example_string = "This is an example of text that will be wrapped."
println(wrap_string(example_string))
```

This function splits the input string into words, then iterates over them to construct lines with a maximum width of `text_width`. If adding a new word would exceed the width, the current line is added to the result and a new line is started.
